cons: None as of right now

review_title: Nepotism in hiring of Executive Leaders, Useless (powerless) HR and Inappropriate Promotions
pros: Good benefits, supportive team atmosphere, rewarding job.
cons: The executive leadership (Chancellor Bjong Wolf Yeigh) loves creating a toxic work environment by hiring a completely unfit supportive team and running it like a tyrant that he is. Strong nepotism allows inept Vice Chancellors to be hired in lieu of incredibly talented pool of candidates from outside. Rest of the supporting staff is treated with zero respect and regard. No accountability for bad behaviors. HR team is a joke and only stand by who pay their checks. Young, inexperienced get promoted which affects student recruitment & retention = worsening budget restraints. Telework agreements are a joke as Yeigh makes it clear that all must work in the office in the middle of a pandemic which shows no sign of improvement. If you want to work for an employer who shows you respect, empathy and integrity, apply elsewhere. The upper management backpaddles on their promises and constantly breaks them.

pros: I really love my shift! When my kids were young the shift was perfect for me. I work 4 days a week and 10 hour shifts and I enjoy it.
cons: Working at night is definitely a con. Lack of sleep.

pros:
Beautiful campus
Nice area
Teamwork
Working with students
cons: Expensive parking, Construction, Underpaid, Overworked, Leadership mismanagement, Constant turnover

review_title: good for a really busy student
pros: Good pay, and they had flexible hours

- Develop strong interpersonal skills

review_title: Great students, poor investment in lecturers
pros: UW Bothell's mission, vision, students, and faculty are amazing. The campus is also really beautiful.
cons: Part-time lecturers have little job security and very low pay. Lecturer contracts can only be renewed for three years. I worked full time (100% in fall, 100% in winter, 90% in spring but with little reduction in responsibilities) but was only given a part-time contract. I was actually verbally promised a full-time contract and then that commitment was reneged.

pros: mission-oriented. You work with smart people and most people really want to create a great experience for students.
cons: College politics. It's a state institution so things you can get done quickly in private industry take a long time.

pros:
- Diverse student body 
- Strong emphasis on diversity, equity and inclusion
- Campus community is incredibly welcoming
cons:
- Low pay
- Staff can be undervalued compared to faculty
- Hours can get long at times

review_title: Terrible pay, constant turnover, no help from HR
pros: People are nice, rewarding work.
cons: The title of this review about sums it up. I work in student affairs and I make significantly less than my peers at other institutions. I have a masters degree and I'm still barely scraping by. My mortgage, which is low for the area, is almost 50% of my salary.

job_title: Assistant Career Advisor in Bothell, WA
pros: Great way to meet students and learn career prep skills. Variety in activities and projects. FT staff cares about their student employees' well-being.
cons: Covid time made it 100% remote. Like any job, some tasks are more interesting than others.

pros: Great learning environment for student employees.

review_title: Over-reliance on cheap adjunct labor becoming a major problem
pros:
Good review process
Great direct supervisors and school directors
Wonderful students
Ability to design and implement your own classes without hardly any outside interference
cons:
Segregated system of part-time adjuncts and full-time faculty--ghettoized office that lumps 20+ part-time faculty into a single room that holds 10 computers.
No path to tenure, no opportunity to advance
No respect for adjunct research

pros: Great student job, flexible hours, awesome student coworkers, light workload, can work on homework during downtime, students who come in for help are generally understanding and polite.
cons: The immediate supervisor is a little awkward and disconnected from student employees as well as the needs of regular students. Unclear or no direction at all and tends to blame students for the results of his lack of directions.

review_title: Beautiful Campus, Great People, Disappointing Salaries and Management
pros: Friendly staff and faculty who share a passion for students and progressive education. Some very special, wonderful people are attracted to this campus with its unique, uplifting spirit.
cons: Big dreams often fall short of big accomplishments due to lack of funds or inability to manage smartly and realistically. Salaries are low and cost of parking is high.

pros:
- student job opportunity, allows you to work and enjoy campus life at the same time. It is not a problem to tell your employer that you are not able to work because of the class schedule. They are very welcome to accommodate you relating to the working hours. 
- If you have completed the daily working tasks, you are allowed to work on your own homework/assignment/group project and such. 
- customer service experience while receiving calls, greeting customers at the front desks and giving campus tour.
cons: - occasionally, you will have to work during weekend for campus event

pros: I've worked as a student at the university for just under a year now.  It's been a great experience.  I work with great people.  It is especially convenient being able to work in the same place where I study.
cons: Not a lot of cons.  The pay isn't awesome, but it's not bad either.  There is a lot of procedure to follow, but no more than would be expected any where else.

pros: The workplace is literally a detached family, it is produvtive and efficient enciorment that takes care of one another. Where there is students there is always going to be food. Thus expect to be well fed.
cons: Unfortunately the pay while it is alright It isn't the op tiered compared to corporate however that is only natural. No one should enter education in attempt to become the richest individual in the world after all.

pros: It's great working on a college campus where you can find awesome students, faculty, and staff. There is always something going on and it's never boring. I work with a great team who is supportive and work extremely hard.
cons: Parking is difficult because you have to compete with the students and the campus is growing rapidly. One downside is also as the campus grows, the feeling of a tight-knit community begins to fade.

review_title: Great spot, most teams are amazing
pros:
Great benefits
Laid back workplace
Lots of options for job development and growth
Flexibility/understanding of life outside of work
cons:
Some bureaucracy you have to deal with
Not the most competitive of wages
It is hard to fire people who are disrupting the workplace

pros: Best group of people you will ever work with. Professional development and pushing you to your potential is something you will experience here. The supportive and team based environment makes University of Washington Bothell a place you could call home.
cons: Absolutely none. Everyone is on board to making sure you grow and reach your full potential.

review_title: Great coworkers, lots of communication, great work environment
pros: You get to see, everyday, who you're putting in all the work for (the students), and it feels great
cons: There is constant change there, so if you aren't a fan of that, maybe not the best place for you.

pros: Flexible work hours and insight into the grading process. Professors set clear grading policies.
cons: Assignments may take longer to grade than amount of hours allotted. Just keep track of your progress and manage your time well.

pros: Student focused environment. Easy commute on the eastside.
cons: Staffing and budgets are inadequate. Limited space, nonexistent budgets, no promotional growth, expectations to engage in scope of work that is not realistic due to staffing shortages.

pros:
Grading workload is limited by part time student work constraints.
One on one time with students and professor you're working for.
Excellent for you're own review.
cons: High stress load with exams, the larger the class, the more exams needed to be graded.

pros: On campus, super flexible with work hours, during midterms or finals it is easy to request off, make up hours flexible as well and a way good to network.
cons: Slow depending on which department you work in.

pros: The working environment was really friendly and you will learn a lot from the real-life office tasks.

pros: There are a lot of opportunities if you know where to connect with them.
